title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki - XWiki

11:49 <kwoot> has joined #xwiki  
11:50 <kwoot> Hi all. You know that your page http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Main/XWikiSyntax shows a velocity error message?  
11:52 <vmassol> nope didn't know :)  
11:52 <vmassol> checking  
11:53 <vmassol> fixing  
11:53 <vmassol> tmortagne broke it  
11:55 <vmassol> kwoot: fixed thanks!  
12:14 <+sburjan> Hello. Why is there no Wiki edit or Page edit category in JIRA ?  
12:14 <vmassol> Web and templates category  
12:14 <mflorea> has quit  
12:15 <vmassol> sburjan: we use the build module name where the affected code is located  
12:16 <vmassol> you can use: "Web - Templates & Resources"  
12:17 <vmassol> ideally we should split our web module into more build modules probably  
12:27 <DrLou> has joined #xwiki  
12:29 <mflorea> has joined #xwiki  
12:36 <tmortagne> has joined #xwiki  
12:43 <kwoot> Is there an easy way to tell a table header to span across all columns? So without telling the number of columns to span?  
12:49 <evalica> has joined #xwiki  
12:50 <Enygma`> has joined #xwiki  
12:50 <kwoot> goit. just do |(% colspan=99 %)  
12:53 <silviar> has joined #xwiki  
13:05 <+tmortagne> kwoot: thanks for the info, did not know it was even possible in html :)  
13:12 <mflorea> has quit  
13:14 <+sburjan> vmassol: I am asking this because I don't know yet the fulld organization of the projects  
13:14 <evalica> has quit  
13:19 <evalica> has joined #xwiki  
13:28 <Enygma`> has quit  
13:28 <Enygma`> has joined #xwiki  
13:53 <sburjan`> has quit  
13:56 <sburjan`> has joined #xwiki  
14:01 <vmassol> guys  
14:01 <vmassol> I'm hesitating  
14:02 <vmassol> I've finished implementing the new override mechanism for components  
14:02 <vmassol> however I've realized I've not kept the component-overrides feature for backward compat  
14:02 <vmassol> I'm wondering if we really need to keep ti  
14:02 <vmassol> (since it means redoing all that I've done… snif....)  
14:03 <vmassol> from all the extesnions that exists on extensions.xwiki.org I don't know one that uses that  
14:03 <vmassol> that said there might be people using it around the world and I wonder it it would be a problem for them  
14:03 <vmassol> I guess it could…. but wdyt?  
14:08 <patrek> has quit  
14:09 <vmassol> ok I'm adding it back….  
14:10 <vmassol> using a good idea proposed by tmortagne: use a priority of 0

16:27 <+sburjan> I have a question. I am using $xwiki.formatDate(dateObject, "dd:MM:YYYY") and I get 2011/10/14 16:43. If I use yyyy I don't get the hour. is this a bug, or it's normal ?  
16:33 <@sdumitriu> YYYY is not valid  
16:34 <@sdumitriu> Use lowercase y  
16:34 <+sburjan> yeah, I've saw that there is no reference to YYYY on SimpleDateFormat javadoc  
16:35 <+sburjan> thanks  
16:53 <sburjan`> has quit  
16:53 <sburjan`> has joined #xwiki  
17:09 <tmortagne> has quit  
17:17 <vmassol> hmmm  
17:17 <vmassol> github hasn't triggered a jenkins build for commons  
17:17 <vmassol> (but platform was triggered)  
17:35 <+Enygma`> why do you say that?  
17:35 <+Enygma`> looks like the previous 2 platform builds were triggered by changes in platform  
17:36 <+Enygma`> and the current build is triggered by you manually, because you asked to build commons  
17:37 <vmassol> i pushed several commits in commons  
17:38 <+Enygma`> https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-commons/commits/master  
17:38 <+Enygma`> then they did not make it to github yet  
17:38 <vmassol> hmm  
17:38 <vmassol> indeed my bad  
17:38 <vmassol> :)  
17:38 <vmassol> was an error in the push  
17:38 <+Enygma`> :)  
17:39 <vmassol> sorry about that  
17:39 <+Enygma`> np

23:26 <jamest> has joined #xwiki  
23:30 <jamest> hi, quick question about newer xwiki installs using LDAP.  From what I tell my old 2.0.x install authorized anyone authenticated via ldap with basic group settings.  I'm setting up a 3.2 instance instead of upgrading and it appears that anyone authenticated via ldap becomes registered but isn't part of any groups.  Do I have to setup a specific ldap group -> xwiki group mapping or is there a way to set default group for these LDAP users that I  
23:36 <jamest> I say it's behaving like this because I can't see the users as part of the XWikiAllGroup and they are getting Error: You are not allowed to view this document or perform this action. when trying to view Main/WebHome
